title: Effects of the insurmountable angiotensin AT receptor antagonist candesartan and the surmountable antagonist losartan on ischemia-reperfusion injury in rat hearts

key_findings.conclusion: Pre-treatment with candesartan 10nM or losartan 3mM immediately prior to ischemia improved the recovery of left ventricular developed pressure as compared to the effect of vehicle (69±3.2% and 64±2.3 vs. 44±6.2%, respectively; P<0.05).
key_findings.evidence: Results from hearts subjected to 25 min of global ischemia and 45 min of reperfusion.

key_findings.conclusion: The cumulative creatine kinase release during the first 30 min of reperfusion in the washout experiments was lower in the candesartan group (28.5±2.30 U, P<0.05), but not in the losartan group (40.8±6.73 U), than in the vehicle group (48.1±4.35 U).
key_findings.evidence: Data from the washout experiments after drug administration.

applicable_situations.advice: Consider pre-treatment with candesartan or losartan to improve left ventricular developed pressure recovery and reduce creatine kinase release.

applicable_situations.situation: Research on angiotensin AT1 receptor antagonists
applicable_situations.advice: Focus on the differences in cardioprotective effects between insurmountable and surmountable receptor antagonists.
